title: How to Make Beer Bratwursts

steps.headline: Cook the sausages in a large skillet over medium heat until thoroughly done.
steps.description: Remove the meat, but keep the oil in the skillet.

steps.headline: Use the rest of the olive oil and cook the onion rings in the same skillet.
steps.description: You'll want the onions to be translucent and cooked, but not brown.

steps.headline: Re-add the sausages to the skillet.
steps.description: Pour the beer into the skillet and allow the meat to simmer for about 12 to 15 minutes. The beer mixed with the oil should transform into a syrup-like sauce.

steps.headline: Serve the bratwursts in large hot dog buns with the onions as toppings.

text: Cook the sausages in a large skillet over medium heat until thoroughly done. Remove the meat, but keep the oil in the skillet. Use the rest of the olive oil and cook the onion rings in the same skillet. You'll want the onions to be translucent and cooked, but not brown. Re-add the sausages to the skillet. Pour the beer into the skillet and allow the meat to simmer for about 12 to 15 minutes. The beer mixed with the oil should transform into a syrup-like sauce. Serve the bratwursts in large hot dog buns with the onions as toppings.
